meanings.definition: Of or relating to a parish or parishes.
meanings.sent1: The parochial church hosted a bake sale to raise funds for the local community.
meanings.sent2: The parochial school celebrated its annual parish festival with games and food.
meanings.sent3: The parochial priest accidentally used salt instead of sugar in the church's bake-off.
meanings.sent4: Her parochial upbringing shaped her strong sense of community and belonging.
meanings.sent5: The parochial atmosphere of the small town made everyone feel like family.

meanings.definition: Having a limited or narrow outlook or scope.
meanings.sent1: His parochial views prevented him from seeing the bigger picture.
meanings.sent2: The parochial mindset of the town council hindered progress on important issues.
meanings.sent3: She found his parochial opinions amusing, considering how diverse the world is.
meanings.sent4: Breaking free from her parochial beliefs opened up a whole new world of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The parochial attitude of the group stifled creativity and innovation.
